title: Friday, 20th July, 2018
bodyHTML:
11:05 am
BE11:06am

Hello!

BE11:06am

Here we are again. Happy as it's possible to be.

Patience Good morning.
BE11:06am

This is Markets Live, FTA's thing with the etc.

epicurean Good morning
Airborne Cigar I'm not as happy as it's possible to be - not until the free drinks this evening...
11:07 am
BE11:07am

Where to begin? What about free advertising?

BE11:07am

cheeckychappy Bit late...
BE11:08am

You'll have seen, literally everywhere, that Cadbury's done a thing.

VV75 morning
11:08 am
BE11:08am

On a Friday at the start of silly season with a midnight embargo.

BE11:09am

A new version of the Cadbury Dairy Milk bar containing 30% less sugar is to go on sale from next year as part of industry efforts to respond to the obesity crisis.

Cadbury owner Mondelez International described the new bar as the "most significant innovation in the brand's history" as it unveiled similar sugar reduction plans for other lines such as Oreo and Maynards Bassetts Wine Gums and Jelly Babies products.

BE11:09am

That's PA.

11:09 am
BE11:09am

Glenn Caton, Mondelez International president for Northern Europe, said the science behind the reformulation was a "trade secret" but said some of the sugar had been replaced with fibre to maintain the original bar's structure and texture.

BE11:09am

"Fibre".

Deep Breath everyone... fibre=cardboard
BE11:10am

So, it's like an Aero except rather than air, it's padded out with some tasteless pabulum or other.

Sails "sugar replaced with fibre" - paper pulp cheaper than sugar probably. So, it;s like RHM seeling us water in bread instead of more expensive wheat
11:10 am
BE11:11am

Longer term plans include a reformulation of Cadbury Brunch bars to cut sugar by around 20% and a lower sugar version of Oreo biscuits.

Bryan morning guys
Sails Research at RHM in the 80s was all about making the bread hold more water (loaves being sold by weight)
Electric Dragon Shredded newspapers add much needed roughage and essential inks.
BE11:12am

...... yeah, okay. Though for the foreseeable they're doing the lo-cal range and the full-sugar range.

Deep Breath everyone... Hands up if you had to look up pabulum?
BornCynic Morning - anyone clock this:https://www.nao.org.uk/report/the-sale-of-student-loans/Who knew that student loans would amount to £473 billion by March 2049? And how can they be so exact on that figure............
Gross Loydman @Deep Guilty!
chopper bear dont get me started this sugar reduction thing makes my blood boil its gone too far and is ruining good products
BE11:13am

So .... it's a chocolate bar launch. That's covered in depth all over the press this morning and has required journalists to get quotes from actual public health bodies.

11:13 am
BE11:14am

Anyway, have this old post from Iz: https://ftalphavil...s-the-new-tobacco/

Deep Breath everyone... Pabulum for the plebs - that's the slogan sorted
Patience Making junk food less junky seems a futile exercise, as consumers will seek out the unimproved range.
undefined
DJX Sky - Disney / Comcast (+Liberty Global), any further opinion?
BE11:15am

Did I mention it's silly season?

Sails Gah, the whole student loan thing is *****. Instead of loans to stidy rubbish subjects there should be grants to study proper ones (engineering etc) - to 70% fewer students
Bryan Yesterday at the close of the market a Spanish media published the purchase of Madrigal by Merck Pharmaceutical, they already have a collaboration with NGM Bio (pvt co), what do you think?
11:15 am
BE11:15am

There's .... like ........... nothing. Nothing whatsoever.

Deep Breath everyone... Well said sails
Lawro People still eat Dairy Milk?
BE11:16am

Though the ROTR are amusing themselves with complaints about how chocolate doesn't taste like it used to and how universities just teach nonsense degrees these days ......

pancakes or waffles @Patience do you reckon? I think if they are able to keep the less-junky one tasting the same as before, it shouldn't be the case?
Alchemy30 Morning, Rhetorical question as its been brought up so much but is it possible all four potential bidders walk from IWG ?!
cheeckychappy How about London house prices BE?
BE11:17am

.... we'll move on shortly to how pop music nowadays is just noise and how you used to be able to leave your door unlocked.

cheeckychappy Where do they go now...?
VV75 Trump just dropped that he's willing to go to 500 billion Chinese imports with tariffs
11:17 am
BE11:17am

Sky, though? Yeah, okay, Sky.

Sky PLC (SKY:LSE): Last: 1,507, down 1.25 (-0.08%), High: 1,509, Low: 1,503, Volume: 486.08k
Deep Breath everyone... @BE- Unis will teach whatever fools are willing to pay for. It's a business.
BE11:17am

(@Alchemy30: of course it is, what kind of question is that?)

pancakes or waffles @VV75 wasn't that the amount announced before or am I mis-remembering?
VladNab @VV75, where did you see this?
11:18 am
BE11:18am

So ....... Comcast drops out of Fox hunting to focus on Sky

Sails @Bryce in my day etc.
Deep Breath everyone... Comcast - in the gutter but looking at the stars
Alchemy30 Would just be surprising to me then :-) One or two bidders sure, but lose all four !
BE11:19am

Sky headed lower in response yesterday on the idea that Fox now has less reason to drag itself into a bidding war.

Deep Breath everyone... Or the unmentionable chasing the uneatable
VV75 It just flashed on Bloomberg, with cnbc named as source
cheeckychappy Something I find odd about estate agencies is that even though the market is tough, with very low sales volumes, they keep on expanding into new London areas i.e. Dexters just opened up on the Chamberlayne Road in Kensal Rise but they have a shop in Maida Vale. Yet there are already many agencies in Kensal Rise. Another example would be Foxton's recent expansion into New Malden. Can somebody explain what is going on?
BE11:20am

Is that correct? Dunno. Neither is UBS.

11:20 am
BE11:20am

We think Sky shares have fallen given the reduced likelihood of a
higher mandatory offer as a result of the ‘chain principle’ - the UK Takeover Panel has previously ruled that Disney’s higher bid for Fox should result in a higher bid for Sky. Separately, press reports have suggested the move by Comcast could signal an implicit agreement where Disney acquires Fox and Comcast acquires Sky. While we think there could be a lull in news flow over the coming weeks, we would not completely rule out Disney/Fox returning with a higher offer for Sky.

Ca$hMoney Any chat on JLIF? popped 20% t'other day. Deal likely to happen?
BE11:20am

Story referred to there is the NYT one.

BE11:21am

https://www.nytime...ry-fox-disney.html

11:21 am
BE11:21am

So ........ what next?

VladNab @cheeckychappy I guess they're positioning themselves to be well-prepared when it all takes off again, although I can't say when that will be... has anyone got a clue?
Deep Breath everyone... @Cheeky - Dexters is arbitraging the property price uplift when the bust stop outside Tesco's is redeveloped as planned and...BOOM!
Sails @cheekychappy Unregulated 'industry', low barriers to entry, house prices rise while % commission stays the same = higher profit
BE11:22am

Near-term, we think Disney may focus on getting approval for its deal from Fox shareholders on 27 July 2018.

BE11:22am

Separately, under UK Takeover rules, Fox has until 9 August 2018 to publish its offer document for Sky meaning news flow on Sky could be limited until this time. Thereafter, the UK Takeover Panel could intervene and start an auction process for Sky. We re-iterate our view that Fox and Sky bring different strategic benefits to Disney – Fox gives scale in content whereas Sky gives expertise in direct-to-consumer, scale in Europe and international growth. For Comcast, acquiring Sky would give it scale in distribution globally and international expansion

cheeckychappy @Deep Breath everyone...I see your a man from the Rise!
Deep Breath everyone... @cheeky - 15 years - still not dead
11:22 am
BE11:23am

They're buyers up to 1500p based on a 1320p fair value.

BE11:23am

leverage for Disney would be 2.5x in 2019E assuming it acquires both Fox/Sky and factoring in RSN divestures. Comcast would be at 2.6x leverage in 2019E assuming a Sky deal. A 1600p offer for Sky would increase pro-forma leverage for both companies by 0.1x and a Sky deal would still be accretive o EFCF for both companies.

Airborne Cigar @BE - and football's not the same since the likes of Sturrock stopped playing...
cheeckychappy @Deep Breath everyone...What's your favourite watering hole? I'm particularly enjoying the new Wolfpack bar on Lonsdale Road in this summer sun...
undefined
Deep Breath everyone... @Cheeky - tend to do "easy" as my default - so the Island
11:24 am
BE11:24am

(@Airborne; or managing, arguably.)

Excel Developer I eat cooking chocolate for lower sugar content.
Deep Breath everyone... Haven't tried Wolfpack yet
cheeckychappy @Deep Breath everyone Not that keen on the Island unless outside...
VladNab @cheecky Got any recs for North London? I've outgrown my local in Camden now
BE11:25am

.......... and .................... um .......................................

BE11:25am

Sirius?

Deep Breath everyone... @Cheeky - the convenience is heavily weighted in my cost/benefit analysis
11:25 am
BE11:25am

I mean, if it's silly season we may as well do the easy targets.

Sirius Minerals PLC (SXX:LSE): Last: 34.10, up 0.74 (+2.22%), High: 34.26, Low: 33.54, Volume: 22.73m
cheeckychappy @VladNabCheck out Wolfpack on Lonsdale Road in Queens Park. New craft bar/pub set up by former Saracens player (I'm a Wasps fan).
BE11:27am

So, we get two more offtake agreements.

hedgehog No leaks on iwg...
cheeckychappy @VladNabMy other favourite is Southhampton Arms in North Kentish Town. More of a Winter place though.
11:27 am
BE11:27am

Guangzhou Eiliseng Biotech Co Ltd and the brilliantly named Yantai Agricultural Means of Production Corporation.

VladNab @Cheecky Saracens fan here so will definitely give it a go
BE11:28am

For 2mtpa, which increases Sirius peak contracted sales to 5.7mtpa. Should be 6.7mtps but there's also a cancellation of a 1mtpa contract with the Yunnan Dian Huang Peony in there so, two steps forward etc.

Swedish Chef Chinese titles don’t always work as intended. I once saw “stew of bacteria” on the menu of a restaurant in Xian. I passed.
VladNab Recently relocated to The Horseshoe by Hampstead station
BE11:29am

Liberum:

11:29 am
BE11:30am

nichoman any chat on mcarthy & stone ? big volume yesterday (for that stock) and up almost 4% but didn't see anything
BE11:31am

They're shop, so have a predictably shop-like comment. "The new offtakes with larger partners [are] likely to improve the credit risk profile which should be helpful to stage 2 financing. These deals are a significant step in de-risking the project, further validating the product and pushing peak contracted sales to just shy of the targeted 6-7mtpa range for stage 2 financing."

BE11:31am

Shore, also shop.

11:31 am
BE11:31am

We have previously opined that there will almost always be delays in projects of such magnitude as Sirius’s, and noted that the company has been doing the right thing in seeking and attempting to capitalise on opportunities to accelerate activities where possible. While Sirius is currently at development stage and still some years from becoming a cash flow-generating company, we believe that an investment in Sirius should become progressively de-risked and enjoy significant value uplift as it advances towards production.

BornCynic If you are looking for things to talk about BE how about Christian Bittar? Earned up to £47 million per year and decided to rig Euribor to get an extra £2.5 million according to the Guardian. Do you get to meet people like that?
undefined
Swedish Chef @born Just like the CEO on millions who puts a sex worker on expenses. Or a MP on £80k who fiddles mileage. Same behaviour, only more zeros.
BE11:35am

..............@BornCynic, speaking generally, I do meet some surprisingly money-driven types.

BornCynic Must admit to knowing of a Finance Director back in to 90's earning £65k who decided to fiddle his expense claims but Christian appears to be in a different league...........
11:36 am
BE11:36am

And I can rarely understand their motivations. But then, if I had £1m I'd go live in a shack on an island without mobile reception.

BE11:37am

(I'd probably do the same if I had £1k, TBH.)

BE11:37am

Anyway, what else? Any interest in Beazley?

VV75 yes
11:37 am
BE11:38am

Numbers weak solely because reserves up on the property portfolio

Swedish Chef BE Many of us on the right have a million and spend our declining years here...
BE11:38am

Oh, and the FD's off. Martin Bride. Been there since 2009.

BE11:39am

And was the main investor contact.

11:39 am
BE11:39am

But it's a long-serving management at Beazley so no reason to worry overly.

BE11:39am

Quick bit of Jefferies.

BE11:40am

Given the industry wide pressures in the Lloyd's market from soft market pricing, the lack of earnings in traditional P&C business is understandable but disappointing. Beazley's need to increase property reserves is disappointing (for EPS) but prudent (in terms of managing risk). With this segment producing virtually none of the earnings and with little value attached in our model though, this simply strengthens our conviction that Beazley are pursuing the right strategy of growth in more attractive business (Specialty Lines).

11:40 am
BE11:40am

"Speciality" is hacker insurance, isn't it?

BE11:40am

At least in part.

BE11:40am

With management targeting double digit premium growth and consensus expecting 10.8%, Beazley's achieved growth of +15.1% is a clear indicator that the group's growth ambitions remain firmly on course. Moreover, in our view, Beazley's Specialty Lines growth is of paramount importance, given that this is the highest margin product. In this context, +15.9% premium growth in Specialty Lines is a positive.

11:40 am
BE11:41am

With such a disproportionate share of the group's value (71%) coming from the Specialty Lines business, reserve releases from the cyber back book are fundamental to our thesis. Thus, with Specialty Lines reserve releases rising a further +16.5% in 1H 2018, the group is continuing to write highly profitable data breach insurance.

BE11:41am

Jefferies remain buyers

BE11:41am

One of the key fundamental negatives leading into these results has been on Beazley's valuation, which at 13x P/E is at a material premium to the sector. We continue to believe that a premium is warranted though, on the basis that investors are getting almost the entire share price back in value from the Specialty Lines business, which continues to outperform. As such, despite today's reaction, we reiterate our Buy recommendation.

alewis2005 @cheekychappy I used to do the monday pub quiz there
Swedish Chef @born I knew someone who drove huge distances unnecessarily because of a ludicrously generous mileage rate. He had a sense of humour failure when I suggested he get his odometer recalibrated in £
11:42 am
undefined
alewis2005 ...if we crowdfund 1k, can we send @BE off somewhere without connectivity?
alewis2005 asking for a friend
BE11:44am

We have to note Trump

BornCynic @Swedish - the best one I heard was a Finance Director went on a witch hunt against another director. Went through his expenses line by line. Worked out that his fuel consuption was way too high. The other director had to provide a picture of his landrover that he used in bad weather.
Deep Breath everyone... Battersea - that's completely unconnected
Excel Developer @BE: what you do on this island, develop a chocolate that tasted of real hops?
BE11:44am

"I’m ready to go to" $500bn of Chinese tariffs, he tells CNBC

11:44 am
BE11:45am

"I’m doing this to do the right thing for our country," is one of his more cogent explanations.

BE11:45am

So, we're down. FTSE now off 0.3%, Stoxx 600 off 0.6%.

VV75 maybe Trump should head the Brexit negotiations, he can't do worse than currently happening
BE11:47am

It'd be great if we had something other to worry about than the bipolar trade war thing, which is so dumb it defies analysis. But here we are. This is what we voted for, collectively.

11:47 am
undefined
sprout Listening to his CNBC interview now - he's remarkably coherent vs other recent outings.
BE11:51am

Gonna be fun trying to file the UK and European market reports tonight. Seriously considering padding them out with a few cartoons or something.

BE11:51am

Are we missing anything? There's Hays, after someone or other slotted a 2.6% stake.

11:51 am
Hays PLC (HAS:LSE): Last: 194.00, down 11.2 (-5.46%), High: 197.60, Low: 192.40, Volume: 43.10m
BE11:52am

40m at 194p.

Excel Developer As unbelievable as it may seem, the president of the United States is a disinformation agent for Russia.
BE11:52am

Equiom Trust, on behalf of Chainpoint Unit Trust.

11:52 am
BE11:52am

Sorry, 2.8% not 2..6%.

Excel Developer https://pbs.twimg.com/media/DiaIG_DV4AAVaEO.jpg:large
GBKrona well noted, Excel Developer!
Excel Developer codename: Agent Orange
BE11:55am

And on sellside, there's very very little unless you're really interested in Panmure saying Nostrum is oversold.

Nostrum Oil & Gas PLC (NOG:LSE): Last: 187.60, up 9.6 (+5.39%), High: 194.00, Low: 185.20, Volume: 95.08k
11:55 am
BE11:55am

Big sector thing.

BE11:56am

The OPEC+ decision to increase output confirms our expectation that Brent heading towards US$80/bbl would be considered too dangerous given the potential negative effect on demand and positive effect on non-OPEC supply, drawing an active response. While we expect the collapse in production from Venezuela to continue and President Trump’s withdrawal from the Iran nuclear deal has raised a significant threat to exports from Iran, we believe it is likely that global spare capacity will prove adequate, particularly given the continuing growth in non-OPEC production above the pace of growth in demand.

Ethnick anything on Just Group, -7%
BE11:56am

Forecasts bumped to reflect "our Brent forecast for 2018 to
US$72/bbl (from US$60/bbl) and our forecasts for 2019 and beyond by US$5/bbl to US$65/bbl"

11:56 am
BE11:57am

..... and recommendation wise

BE11:57am

Following the sector outperformance, we cut our sector stance to Neutral when Russia called for an increase in production. We maintain that stance and our existing recommendations apart from Nostrum which we upgrade to Buy from Hold following its hefty underperformance since its last profit warning. Our top picks remain Eland (TP 165p) and Phoenix (TP 50p), of the majors we prefer Shell (TP 2,700p) and we remain Sellers of Tullow (TP 195p).

undefined
11:57 am
BE11:58am

Been asking around on Just Group .....

Just Group PLC (JUST:LSE): Last: 119.99, down 8.81 (-6.84%), High: 127.88, Low: 119.00, Volume: 1.74m
BE11:59am

Down hard on good volume, about twice the daily average so far ......

BornCynic Thanks BE / ROTR
Sails yes, thanks all
tadam @VV75 Yes, Trump should negotiate it. He has cut so many successful international deals while president.
12:00 pm
BE12:01pm

.......... and, nothing back yet. Sorry.

BE12:01pm

If anyone has info worth sharing the FT emails goes firstname.lastname@ft.com

undefined
12:02 pm
BE12:02pm

Wow, that was slow. But we got there.

BE12:03pm

Thanks for hanging around. Back Monday.

BE12:03pm

Afternoon all.

Excel Developer bye
